results.title: Preparing simvastatin nanoparticles by a combination of pH-sensitive and timed-release approaches for the potential treatment of ulcerative colitis.
results.text_hl: Drug release was studied in different physiological environments. @<m>DISEASE_Colitis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003092 @@@Colitis@@@ was induced by 3% of @CHEMICAL_Acetic_Acid @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019342 @@@acetic acid@@@ in @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@, which received NPs of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@SIM@@@ (10 mg/kg/day), @CHEMICAL_Mesalamine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019804 @@@mesalazine@@@ (150 mg/kg/day), blank NPs and normal saline orally for 5 days.

citations.NLM: Fardafshari F, Taymouri S, Minaiyan M, Tavakoli N. Preparing simvastatin nanoparticles by a combination of pH-sensitive and timed-release approaches for the potential treatment of ulcerative colitis. J Biomater Appl. 2022 Nov;37(5):859-871. PMID: 35999010

results.title: Effects of statins on experimental colitis in normocholesterolemic rats.
results.text_hl: RESULTS: Treatment with @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@SIM@@@ reduced the lesion score of the @<m>DISEASE_Colitis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003092 @@@colitis@@@ group at macroscopic level (p<0.05), but there was no effect of treatment with @CHEMICAL_Fluvastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077340 @@@FLU@@@.

citations.NLM: Jahovic N, Gedik N, Ercan F, Sirvanci S, Yüksel M, Sener G, Alican I. Effects of statins on experimental colitis in normocholesterolemic rats. Scand J Gastroenterol. 2006 Aug;41(8):954-62. PMID: 16803694

results.title: Simvastatin induces apoptosis in human colon cancer cells and in tumor xenografts, and attenuates colitis-associated colon cancer in mice.
results.text_hl: We previously demonstrated that @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ inhibits @GENE_NFKB1 @GENE_4790 @@@NF-kappaB@@@ signaling in @SPECIES_9606 @@@human@@@ intestinal epithelial cells and ameliorates acute @SPECIES_10090 @@@murine@@@ @<m>DISEASE_Colitis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003092 @@@colitis@@@.
